moves.2. b3: White does ok with d4 or Nf3.  Not so much this one.
moves.3... Nxe4 4. Qf3 Ng5 5. Qg4 h6 6. Qf4 e5: Moving the queen around let's black develop.  White ends up moving the queen eight times in a row, permitting black enormous control of the center.
moves.7... d6 8. Qd3 Nb4: White should not leave Pc2 undefended.
moves.12. f4 exf4 13. gxf4 d5 14. Qd4: OMG no!  The queen is lost by knight fork, king, queen, rook.
moves.14... Nxc2+ 15. Kd1 Bf5: Uh, no, I think NxQ is suggested here.
moves.16. fxg5: Like what is Nc2?  Chopped liver?
moves.16... h5: NxQ!  NxQ!  White should play Qe5+, followed by QxBf5 if black interposes the black bishop.  If black chooses the white bishop, obviously KxNc2.  Black will most likely select the queen.
